pullRequest.body:
The definition of `NoZeroSMulDivisors` doesn't require us to know about modules. By splitting off this definition, we can streamline the downstream import graph a bit.

In the process, generalize a few instances from `Module` to `SMulWithZero`.

New files:
 * `NoZeroSMulDivisors/Defs.lean`: definition and basic results that don't require `Module`
 * `NoZeroSMulDivisors/Basic.lean`: basic results that require `Module`
 * `NoZeroSMulDivisors/Pi.lean`: results on `NoZeroSMulDivisors _ (_ -> _)` that don't require `Module`
 * `NoZeroSMulDivisors/Prod.lean`: results on `NoZeroSMulDivisors _ (_ x _)` that don't require `Module`


---

Hmm, the downstream changes are not as impressive as I was hoping. Still, a few files with drastically reduced imports.
My gut feeling is that this mild nuisance is worth the trade off. The two PRs that depend on this (#17913 and #17919) give a quite a nice reduction in import counts.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11415713104/job/31766070579)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11415713104/job/31766070662)

It's not immediately clear to me whether the `Pi` and `Prod` file are a good idea; putting every instance of `Foo Bar` in `Foo/Bar.lean` is a recipe for users never being able to find the instance they need! Then again, we already do this for Prod and Pi elsewhere...

Hmm, the downstream changes are not as impressive as I was hoping. Still, a few files with drastically reduced imports.

It's not immediately clear to me whether the `Pi` and `Prod` file are a good idea; putting every instance of `Foo Bar` in `Foo/Bar.lean` is a recipe for users never being able to find the instance they need! Then again, we already do this for Prod and Pi elsewhere...
My gut feeling is that this mild nuisance is worth the trade off. The two PRs that depend on this (#17913 and #17919) give a quite a nice reduction in import counts.
